choices.F: Run the CQD User Feedback (Rate My Call) Report.
choices.D: Install the Power BI connector for Call Quality Dashboard (CQD).
choices.A: Upload a file to the Reporting Labels page.
choices.E: Upload a file to the Tenant Data Upload page.

discussion.content:
C. Create a building data file: This allows you to map call quality data to specific locations and identify which sites are experiencing issues
E. Upload a file to the Tenant Data Upload page: 
in the CQD, select the gear icon (Settings) at the top of the Summary Reports page.
Choose Tenant Data Upload from the menu.
Click Browse to select your building data file.
Specify the Start date for the data and optionally an End date.
Click Upload to upload the file

A. Upload a file to the Reporting Labels page:
This action helps label and categorize call data, making it easier to analyze and identify trends related to specific sites, buildings, or subnets.

E. Upload a file to the Tenant Data Upload page:
Uploading a file with detailed network topology information (such as sites, subnets, and building data) allows the Call Quality Dashboard (CQD) to associate call quality data with specific network locations. This enables you to identify which sites are experiencing poor call quality.

questions.question_text:
In the Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard, you discover an increasing trend of poor-quality calls.

You need to implement a solution to identify problematic sites.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.B: hold and resume of PSTN calls

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You use Direct Routing with a Survivable Branch Appliance (SBA) at a site.

The site experiences an extended internet outage.

Which three PSTN calling scenarios are possible during the outage? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
When the Microsoft Teams client is in offline mode, the following calling-related functionality is available:
Making PSTN calls via local SBA/SBC with media flowing through the SBC.
Receiving PSTN calls via local SBA/SBC with media flowing through the SBC.
Hold and Resume of PSTN calls.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-survivable-branch-appliance

Selected Answer: ABD
Dynamic Emergency Call Routing is not available with SBA
